FacilityName: Hi Line Cooperative Inc. - Roscoe Tank Farm

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Hi Line Cooperative, Inc.
P.O. Box 96
Elsie, NE  69134-0096

Anhydrous Ammonia Nurse Tank Storage at Roscoe, NE

Risk Management Plan ? EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Facility Policy:

The management and employees operating each of our facilities are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of hazardous material transported or stored on our locations. In the event an accidental release should occur, we are prepared to work with our Local Fire Company(s), Emergency Response Personnel, and other appropriate authorities deemed applicable to the specific incident. 

Facility Information:

The primary activity of our company is NAICS code 424910, ?Farm Supply Merchant Wholesalers?. 

Anhydrous ammonia is stored in nurse tanks and distributed for direct application to farm fields during the early spring and fall months. During the balance of the year little if any product storage occurs at this location. The facility is also operated on an ?as needed? basis with staff present only for movement of nurse tanks. Our facilities have adequate lighting and are inspected at various times of day and night. 

Worst Case Scenario:

The maximum quantity released and the distance to endpoint calculations have been shared with the appropriate emergency planning and response agencies. Possible public and environmental receptors with the area have been provided to the Keith County LEPC for their consideration. 

Alternate Case Scenario:

There has not been a release of anhydrous ammonia on which to base this scenario. We decided to use a transfer valve incident for this scenario and the quantity released and the distance to endpoint calculations have been shared with the appropriate emergency planning and response agencies. 

Accidental Release Program and Planning:

Our anhydrous ammonia accidental release program is based on guidelines found in the ANSI Standard K61.1, ?Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia; and the U.S. OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.111,

?Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia?. We conduct annual employee training on the safe handling, transportation and distribution of anhydrous ammonia and have installed safety equipment including but not limited to: Excess flow valves, Positive Shut-off valves, and Emergency Couplers at transfer points. We have developed an Emergency Action Plan for employees, customers, and visitor protection. This plan initiates evacuation, emergency medical care, contacts for assistance, etc. for this anhydrous ammonia facility and the employees that staff it. 

Additional Information:

For additional information, response to questions,  or comments please contact:
